function: Display a user's link tree with visually styled components on a themed background.
static_description: The page displays a centered vertical list of clickable links over a papaya whip background. Each link is rendered in a card styled with dark orange borders and text. At the top, there is a header showing the user's name or avatar represented by 'link_tree_icon'.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking any link navigates the user to the target URL in a new tab.
Hovering over a link highlights it slightly with a shadow effect while maintaining the dark orange theme.

function: Manage authenticated sessions for users to access their personalized link trees.
static_description: A modal or dedicated route shows login/signup forms. Fields include email, password, and username where applicable. Submit buttons are present along with social login options if needed.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Login' or 'Sign Up' submits credentials via auth_session_api and redirects upon success.
Pressing enter after filling out either field triggers submission.

resource_dependency.user_profile_schema: Table: users { id UUID primary key, username STRING unique, created_at TIMESTAMP }

function: Allow users to create a unique profile which serves as the root for their personal link tree.
static_description: After successful authentication, a prompt appears asking the user to set up their profile with a preferred username. A confirmation button confirms creation.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting the form calls profile_creation_api to register the user’s unique link tree profile.

function: Enable users to add new links to their personal link tree through validated form input.
static_description: An 'Add Link' button reveals a form containing title and URL input fields alongside a submit button. All elements follow the dark orange styling.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Submit' validates inputs against url_validation_regex and sends data to link_submit_api.
Real-time feedback indicates invalid URL formats during typing.

resource_dependency.existing_link_data: { id: UUID, title: STRING, url: STRING }

function: Provide functionality for users to modify details of existing links within their link tree.
static_description: Each link entry includes an 'Edit' icon next to it. Clicking this opens a pre-filled form identical in structure to the add link form but populated with current values.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Save Changes' updates the link using edit_link_api with modified data.

function: Allow deletion of unwanted links from a user's link tree.
static_description: Next to each link, a trash bin icon represents the delete action. It maintains consistent styling with other interactive elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the delete icon prompts a confirmation dialog. Confirming removes the link via delete_link_api.

function: Expose RESTful API endpoints enabling full lifecycle management of user-specific link data.
static_description: These endpoints are configured behind authentication middleware ensuring only authorized access to respective user data.

function: Establish secure database connectivity for persistent storage using provided PostgreSQL configuration.
static_description: Backend initializes connection pool referencing pg_client_library and uses db_connection_config environment variables at startup.

resource_dependency.users_table_schema: CREATE TABLE users (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL, created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW());
resource_dependency.links_table_schema: CREATE TABLE links (id UUID PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT gen_random_uuid(), user_id UUID REFERENCES users(id), title TEXT NOT NULL, url TEXT NOT NULL, position INTEGER, created_at TIMESTAMPTZ DEFAULT NOW());

function: Define relational database schema supporting user profiles and their associated links.
static_description: Two tables are created: one for storing user identities and another mapping links to those users with optional ordering support.

resource_dependency.shareable_link_generator: Generates shareable URLs based on username lookup

function: Automatically generate and assign a publicly accessible URL tied to each individual user's link tree.
static_description: Upon profile creation, a shareable path such as '/u/john_doe' becomes available for public viewing of john_doe’s link tree.

resource_dependency.public_link_tree_renderer: Renders read-only version of user's links without requiring login

function: Render a publicly visible page displaying a user's curated collection of links without authentication.
static_description: This endpoint returns HTML/CSS rendering of the same styled link cards used in private views but omits edit/delete controls.

resource_dependency.mobile_first_layout: flexbox-based columnar arrangement adjusting padding/margin for small screens

function: Ensure optimal display experience across various device sizes including desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
static_description: Layout adjusts dynamically using CSS media queries. Cards stack vertically on smaller screens while maintaining color scheme consistency.

resource_dependency.form_validator_utility: Built-in regex validation + frontend JS logic
resource_dependency.error_message_templates: { invalidUrl: 'Please enter a valid URL starting with http(s)' }

function: Enforce correctness of submitted link data by validating format before processing.
static_description: Validation messages appear inline beneath respective fields when incorrect data is entered.

interaction_and_states.description: Leaving an unfilled or incorrectly formatted field triggers immediate validation message.

function: Provide clear indicators during asynchronous operations and inform users about request outcomes.
static_description: During API requests, a spinner overlays relevant sections. Toast notifications show brief status updates for errors/successes.

interaction_and_states.description: Shows toast notification with descriptive error message.

resource_dependency.concurrent_dev_script: concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"
resource_dependency.package_json_scripts: { "install:all": "npm install && cd frontend && npm install && cd ../backend && npm install", "dev": "concurrently ..." }

function: Facilitate simultaneous local development of both frontend and backend services through unified command execution.
static_description: Scripts defined inside package.json enable developers to bootstrap entire application stack with simple terminal commands.
